Reviews.Title: “Super Hostal in trendy surrounding”
Reviews.Author: Spoorenberg1
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull Hostal in trendy and living part of Madrid. We stayed there for 3 nights and the room we stayed in was well prepared, good beds and nice and clean bathroom. The owner was very helpfull and spoke a little English.The Hostal is well situated in walking distance of all the main sights of Madrid.Very good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe and central location, comfort, helpful owner”
Reviews.Author: Sil L
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 were young adults) stayed at Benamar for three days, Dec. 25-28 and were very happy with this place. Very close to the metro, easy to get to from airport. We had two doubles with private bathroom and balconies facing the street. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. José Martín and his wife were very friendly and helpful when we had questions regarding internet access and directions. At the time we were there, José Martín hadn't gotten WiFi (they were getting it a week from dates we were there) so we had a dated computer, but were able to connect to internet most of the time. The only negatives are the thin walls - we could hear our kids next door, and there are no elevators - you'll have to carry luggage up four flights of stairs. Would recommend Benamar for the value, safe and clean rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and helpful owners”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: Never met such friendly owner, helps out with nearly anything and you run into him all the time. Typical traveller hostal but clean and safe. Takes about 20 minutes to walk to Puerta de Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, Extras too”
Reviews.Author: melanieandbill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for nine days. The location is close to the metro (Tribunal)--great for us as we took the metro from the airport (beware of pickpockets in the metro as you are a target with suitcases/backpacks. Have nothing of value in the backpack. The room was an interior on, facing the enclosed courtyard and on the fourth floor. It was immaculate clean, spacious and met our needs. A no-frills place to stay in a good, safe neighborhood , close to good cafes, places to eat and the downton center e.g., two metro stops to Sol. The owners, Jose and Mari, are very simpaticos and helpful. We didn't need their help as we got by with all the info we needed. We saw Mari more than we saw Jose. There is no elevator so you climb stairs (figure that in). When we ofered to pay the room charge the second day, Mari sort of shrugged it off "today, tomorrow, whenever, you decide (in Spanish)". We made the reservation by internet and had a confimration that same way. We believe the rooms are recenlty renovated and the price, the location made it a good choice an excellent value. Check to see if the rooms have AC if you visit in the hot season. We believe some do. Knowing Spanish helps as you are in their country. RE: the reservation, we asked for a room facing the street (didn't get it--didn't inquire why) and also about the availability of a hair dryer in the room. We were told one was "disponible" (available). We didn't have a hair dryer provided. No big deal as we bought an inexpensive one to use on another trip. There was however, in the room a flat-screen TV and a computer with good internet service (no printer). Helpful as we could search in Spanish for info we needed--from bus stations to restaurants locations!! We'd return again.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel, great location and greater prices!”
Reviews.Author: 01brian01
Reviews.Content: I could not mention any reasonable fault with our stay in this hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is minutes away from Tribunal metro -though you can easily walk onto the Gran Via and Old Madrid from here. My single room, though on the small side, was comfortable and cleaned everyday. My friend's room had a balcony, was spacious and even had a computer for personal use. At 37 euros a night - you'd be daft to stay anywhere else. No regrets whatsoever - just do it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for urban travellers”
Reviews.Author: permanentvacationist
Reviews.Content: I"ve stayed in this family run hostal for a night (well, i"ve stayed here for 2 times for a week in last 3 years). the renovation of the building is finished and it looks really great. the hostal flats are also quite new and clean. the room that i"ve got for big enough for me and was silent since it was facing interior. in a city like Madrid, you would only visit your room for sleeping! i supposed that rooms facing the reception desk can be bit noisy in the day time. the computers in the rooms are really retro and useful, or you can just plug ethernet cable to your laptop/netbook and go! you can ask for a longer ethernet cable (or bring your owns) if you want to use it in your bed. well, this is totally free internet service that we've just missed in other hotels. the price is quite good for equivalent places, and the people are very warm. there is small shop for food/water/beer downstairs as well as nice and small restaurant with 9 euro menus for lunchs. if you are into contemporary art just next building is a nice gallery. if you are into romanticism, there is a museum of romanticism just across the street. the hostal is just between chueca district (horteleza) & fuencarral shopping street and very close to tribunal metro station. 5-10 minutes to gran via however walking through the calle fuencarral makes it longer because of the nice shops on the way. drawbacks of the place (not really for me) is there is no elevator and rooms are on 2nd & 3rd floor. i love the sweet sound of the wooden stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Better than any other hostals in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SeeWhyZen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Spain last week and stayed for 3 nights at Hostal Benamar. The owners are a couple. Both of them are super friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. It's between two metro stops "Tribunal" and "Alonso Martinez", and equally close to either one. "Tribunal" if the only stop in the entire metro system which gets you to all 3 major train stations (Atocha, Principe Pio, and Chamartin) with direct train. You also need to transfer only once to get to the airport. The hostel is located on the 2nd and 3rd fl. (which equals to the 3rd and 4th fl. in the U.S.). At our arrival we were so tired and of course frustrated to find that there's no elevator in the building. Jose found me upstairs alone with no luggage and understood our difficulty immediately without me speaking out anything. He ran downstairs right away and carried all the bags for us. The room is clean is spacious -much bigger than any hotel rooms we stayed in other cities in Spain. The bathroom is in the same good condition. The only shortage, if I have to come up with one, would be the thin walls. During our first-night stay, there were loud guests in other rooms. However the second and the third night were perfect. Overall this is an unbeatable value compared with what we paid for hotel rooms. We spent almost double for our hotel room in Barcelona for the same length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a welcoming environment”
Reviews.Author: CFValencia
Reviews.Content: Spent three weeks here and would definitely recommend it for the price. The owner was fantastic and was always very accommodating and ready to answer any questions. It's not a five star hotel by any means but you more than get what you pay for. The location is also very good, lots of nightlife and decent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: andrewRH3
Reviews.Content: Very clean hostal located about a ten minute walk away from Sol. Very close to Tribunal and Alonso Martinez metro stops, which makes any destination easy to get to (including the airport). While you get a very clean, newly renovated individual room, don't expect any toiletries or other amentities you might expect from a hotel. There is a TV and a very old computer running Windows 98 that has free internet access. Once you check in and get your key, it is hard to get in touch with Jose, the very friendly owner. If any problems occur, you are on your own. Also, make sure not to be noisy, as we almost got kicked out of the hostal one night for making too much noise. If you need a basic room with a good location for a very good price that is extremely clean and managed by a friendly, trustworthy local, Hostal Benamar is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Benamar Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a welcoming hostal, recently renovated, nicely done bathrooms. Owner Jose Martin quite friendly. Free in-room internet a plus. We would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “good inexpensive hostal”
Reviews.Author: whastever
Reviews.Content: This was a good inexpensive hostal. I?ve spent three weeks in total there. Jos? the owner was an excellent and friendly host. Its not far from the centre and close to Tribunal metro and also some decent bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasured of spending a week at the Hostal Benamar in Madrid. It is well located, near the Tribunal Metro Station, within walking distance of some very good (and inexpensive) restaurants. The owner/operator of the Hostal, don José, was a most excellent host. Veery knowledgeable about Madrid and Spain. The place is spotlessly clean, and the people are very friendly. I would recommend this Hostal to anyone planning a stay in the Spanish capital.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Benamar
HotelInfo.Address: C/San Mateo 20 | nº 20 2º y 3º Dcha., 28004 Madrid, Spain
